final_answer.precision_note: 3 s.f., limited by NaOH concentration 0.150 mol dm-3 (3 s.f.).

method: Convert the NaOH volume to dm3: 23.40 cm3 = 0.02340 dm3. Moles of NaOH = cV = 0.150 × 0.02340 = 0.00351 mol. From H2SO4 + 2NaOH → Na2SO4 + 2H2O, 2 mol NaOH react with 1 mol H2SO4, so moles H2SO4 = 0.00351/2 = 0.001755 mol. Convert the acid volume: 25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3. Concentration of H2SO4 = n/V = 0.001755/0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Moles NaOH is about 3.5×10^-3; halving gives ~1.75×10^-3 mol acid in 0.025 dm3, so c should be ~0.07 mol dm-3.
